When you are not able to play hook or pull, so just play the strokes that you know," Sehwag had said on Cricbuzz.
Article Summary: Bangladesh are all but through to the 'Super 8s' stage of the T20 World Cup. They have won two of their three matches in Group D, including a win over former champions Sri Lanka. A video clip of Shakib Al Hasan at the post-match press conference went viral.

Article Title: Gautam Gambhir: 'Indian team's coaching is slightly different...': Anil Kumble on Gautam Gambhir emerging as top candidate for head coach's role
Article Text:
Top Picks For You For Gautam Gambhir, rejecting a player based on 'yo-yo test' not the right way

NEW DELHI: Gautam Gambhir , the mentor of Kolkata Knight Riders ( KKR ) and former India opener, is emerging as the leading candidate for the position of head coach of the Indian national cricket team as per recent media reports.The Board of Control for Cricket in India ( BCCI ) is on the lookout for a successor to the current coach, Rahul Dravid , whose term concludes after the ongoing 2024 ICC T20 World Cup.Gambhir's potential candidacy is bolstered by his recent achievement of guiding KKR to an IPL title as a mentor. Anil Kumble , the former Indian cricketer and legendary spinner, stated that coaching a national team is quite different from coaching a franchise. Kumble emphasized the importance of strong leadership, especially given the transitional phase with several senior players nearing the end of their careers."Rahul has done a fantastic job, and hopefully, for him and India's sake, he has a swansong with the World Cup. What you also have to keep in mind is that some of the senior players are coming towards the backend of their careers. You need players who go through the transition period and ensure India doesn't miss out on the quality in the bowling and batting department. You pick and choose and transition through," Kumble told ESPNCricinfo."You have to give it time. He certainly is capable. We have seen Gautam handle teams. He has been a captain for India, for his franchise, for Delhi. He has all the credentials to be that. But the Indian team's coaching is slightly different, you have to give him time to settle in. Like I mentioned, in case he takes up the job, he will have the task of looking at not just the current lot, but also the future of Indian cricket," Kumble elaborated.Gambhir is well-acquainted with many senior players in the current Indian team, alongside upcoming talents like Rinku Singh. However, Kumble believes that this familiarity may not play a significant role in the selection process."Today, you have been a part of the system in some form or the other. Whether you're a coach or player, you've played with them or been associated with them in some form or the other. It doesn't matter that much. What you look at is the candidature and not whether this particular coach has a background of playing with the players," Kumble said."I think it's important to choose the right candidate in terms of what they can bring to the Indian team, and someone who has the stature and the credibility to handle the certain situations in the game. Someone who is not afraid to take those calls," Kumble added.Selecting the new head coach entails considering their ability to navigate the team through transitional periods while maintaining performance.With Gambhir's track record as a player and mentor, he seems equipped to handle the challenges, provided he gets the necessary time to establish his role.
Article Summary: The Board of Control for Cricket in India ( BCCI ) is on the lookout for a successor to the current coach, Rahul Dravid. Gambhir's potential candidacy is bolstered by his recent achievement of guiding KKR to an IPL title as a mentor.

Article Title: Bengal Pro T20 League: Mukesh, Jayojit power Malda to victory
Article Text: KOLKATA: India pacer Mukesh Kumar was instrumental for Sobisco Smashers Malda ’s comfortable seven-wicket victory against Lux Shyam Kolkata Tigers in the Bengal Pro T20 League at the Eden Gardens here on Friday.The India pacer bowled with lots of fire to restrict the Tigers to 117 for eight in 20 overs after Mukesh won the toss and put the rivals in.Bengal opener Jayojit Basu then scored a fine 50-ball 55 to script an easy victory.In spite of getting a decent start, the Tigers could not carry on the momentum and lost way in the middle stage. Opener Subham Chatterjee showed a lot of grit for his 35 that came off 40 balls with the help of four boundaries.Akash Pandey gave him good support as the duo stitched together a 32-run fifth-wicket stand. Pandey hit four sixes before finally falling to Mukesh after a 30-run innings.Mukesh finished with three for 10 in his four overs that included one maiden over too.Akhil Nandy (2-17) also bowled well for the Smashers.While chasing, the Smashers were in some trouble losing two wickets inside the first six overs. But Jayojit and Writam Porel kept their cool to put up a 62-run third-wicket stand. Jayojit hit five boundaries and two sixes during his knock. Porel on the other hand remained undefeated on 35 playing 36 deliveries and hitting two fours and one six.For the Tigers, Akash was the most successful bowler, bagging two for 10 in his four overs.
Article Summary: India pacer Mukesh Kumar was instrumental for Sobisco Smashers Malda ’s comfortable seven-wicket victory against Lux Shyam Kolkata Tigers in the Bengal Pro T20 League. The India pacer bowled with lots of fire to restrict the Tigers to 117 for eight in 20 overs.

Article Title: Mark Wood says Josh Hazlewood's T20 World Cup remarks 'sign of respect'
Article Text: NEW DELHI: England fast bowler Mark Wood believes Australia will compete "hard and fair" in their upcoming T20 World Cup match against Scotland. This match could potentially lead to the defending champions' elimination.Australian bowler Josh Hazlewood stirred controversy by stating, "it's in our best interest" to witness England's early exit. He did not rule out altering their gameplay to help Scotland reach the Super Eights rather than England in Group B.Wood insists that their Ashes rivals will not deliberately under-perform in Saturday's game, which follows England's match against Namibia."I think that's part of being England and Australia, isn't it?" said Wood."I think actually I saw it more as a respect thing if I'm honest that he was saying that England have done well against Australia in the recent past and thinks we're a big threat and a big team so I have no problem with it."Australia have secured a spot in the second round after winning all three of their games, including a 36-run victory over England.Scotland stands in second place following a no-result match against England, along with victories over Namibia and Oman.England trail two points behind Scotland but have a superior run-rate, which will serve as the tie-breaker if both teams end up with the same number of points."I'm absolutely confident Australia will play the game the hardest, that's the Australian way, that they'll play hard but fair and try and get the win," said Wood.
Article Summary: England fast bowler Mark Wood believes Australia will compete "hard and fair" in their upcoming T20 World Cup match against Scotland. Match could potentially lead to the defending champions' elimination. Australia have secured a spot in the second round after winning all three of their games, including a 36-run victory over England.

Article Title: Great to watch Rishabh Pant's lateral movements and dives while keeping: Fielding coach Dilip
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Rishabh Pant 's dynamic batting since his return has delighted everyone, but Indian team's fielding coach, T Dilip , is especially impressed by his exceptional glovework and acrobatics behind the stumps after undergoing major knee surgery.Pant made his competitive cricket comeback in the last IPL after a long recovery from a severe car accident in December 2022. He has been a key player for the team in this T20 World Cup, delivering crucial performances at No. 3. His wicketkeeping skills have also been outstanding."The best thing is that Rishabh has done so well in his comeback. Especially the batting is considered to be very good. But one of the good things about him is the way he came back as a wicketkeeper," Dilip said ahead of the team's last group league game against Canada.For the fielding coach, Pant’s smooth lateral movements post-surgery are particularly significant."Especially with an injury he had, to come back as a wicketkeeper and do that lateral movement, so that is very heartening to see."Commenting on Pant's batting strategy, the coach mentioned that the player practices intense simulations in the nets, which aids him during actual matches."Coming to your question about batting differently, having different plans in the match, it's a strategy, it's something which Rishabh always does, is that he tries everything in practice whatever comes in a match so that he is well prepared with his options whatever he wants to try in a match."Dilip has been with the team for over two years and noted remarkable improvements in the fast bowlers' fielding abilities, particularly in critical positions. An example of this is Mohammed Siraj’s catch of USA's Nitish Kumar at deep mid-wicket."If I really want to go to specifics, what's heartening to see is the bowlers doing really well. Yes, Jadeja is very good, Virat Kohli is good, Rohit Sharma is good. They were doing very well before."But then what's happening is the bowlers doing really well, which is adding up as you can see that now the bowlers are standing in hot spots. So, that's a great sign for a team."So that, what will happen in that, Rohit Sharma will get the versatility (options) that he doesn't have to look for any place. That versatility is allowing him to keep good fielders at positions all the time."When asked for more details, Dilip highlighted that bowlers, even after long spells, return the next day for optional training sessions."After long bowling spells and coming back and especially most of the optional sessions, they are taking that initiative to come for the practice. That is first thing."And in that process, two important things we did in this, we try to do in this tournament, is attitude and attention to detail."Attention to detail means when the ball is going on the boundary... slow outfield, you all were never giving up till last moment, backing up when somebody is throwing."Dilip, who has experience working with notable baseball coach Mike King, stated that he incorporates some baseball throwing techniques into cricket practice."I love it because there are certain things which I have been using for pretty long, because back in there, I had an opportunity to work with Mike King, with an Australian team. He was a baseball player, so quite a few inputs from that game have really helped me in cricket," said Dilip, who along with a few players and support staff, went to watch a Yankees game during their stay in New York."Other day, we went to Yankees Stadium, so we watched some baseball stuff out there and we met an NFL player, so it's diverse sports, so we try to get in what we can learn from other sports, so it gives an opportunity to look into other sports."
Article Summary: Rishabh Pant made his competitive cricket comeback in the last IPL after a long recovery from a severe car accident in December 2022. Indian team's fielding coach, T Dilip, is especially impressed by his exceptional glovework and acrobatics behind the stumps.

Article Title: 'Ye to shuru hote hi khatam!': Internet in overdrive after Pakistan's early exit from T20 World Cup
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The United States cricket team on Friday created history as they qualified for the second round of the 2024 T20 World Cup on debut after their last group game against Ireland was washed out in Lauderhill, Florida.The washout of the USA vs Ireland game meant former champions Pakistan were eliminated.Rain and wet outfield forced the abandonment even without toss happening as USA advanced to the Super Eight stage from Group A alongside favourites India.As the USA rejoiced their advancement to the next stage of the cricketing extravaganza, social media went in overdrive, trolling Pakistan for their early exit.The USA reached the last eight in their debut appearance in the T20 World Cup largely thanks to their shock Super Over win over 2009 champions Pakistan.The early exit is a bitter disappointment though for Pakistan, who were beaten finalists in the tournament two years ago.The washout also gave USA an automatic qualification in the 2026 T20 World Cup in India and Sri Lanka.
Article Summary: The United States cricket team qualified for the second round of the 2024 T20 World Cup on debut after their last group game against Ireland was washed out. The washout of the USA vs Ireland game meant former champions Pakistan were eliminated. The USA reached the last eight in their debut appearance in the T 20 World Cup largely thanks to their shock Super Over win over 2009 champions Pakistan.

Article Title: Historic! Newcomers USA join India in T20 World Cup Super 8s; Pakistan eliminated
Article Text:
|

NEW DELHI: First-timers USA, featuring several players who juggle cricket with their primary occupations, on Friday advanced to the next round of the 2024 T20 World Cup in the Americas after their last Group A match against Ireland in Lauderhill, Florida got washed out.The USA vs Ireland washout meant that the 2009 champions Pakistan were eliminated from the tournament.Riding victories against neighbors Canada and tournament heavyweights Pakistan in their initial matches, the USA secured a spot in the Super Eight stage.Their final group match's cancellation allowed them to join India in the next round of the cricketing extravaganza.The USA ended the group stage with five points from four matches.Now even if Pakistan win their remaining match against Ireland, they can only achieve a maximum of four points.Pakistan had already faced setbacks prior to the washout. They lost narrowly to India in New York while chasing a target of 120.Earlier, their opening match in Dallas ended in a surprising Super Over defeat to the USA.The consecutive losses meant Pakistan's progression to the Super Eight depended on other results.The tournament is being jointly hosted by the USA and the West Indies as part of an ICC initiative aimed at expanding cricket's footprint in the region.The USA team's performance so far suggests a genuine attempt to entice NFL, MLB, and NBA fans towards cricket.The USA began their campaign with a decisive victory over Canada, chasing nearly 200 runs. They then pulled off one of the T20 World Cup's biggest upsets by beating Pakistan.In their match against India, they posed a strong challenge to the title contenders. USA's momentum can be traced back to their morale-boosting T20I series win against Bangladesh ahead of the tournament.The USA team includes eight players of Indian descent, many of whom hold temporary H1-B visas that allow companies to employ international workers. These players are helping to revive cricket in the USA, a country that hosted the first international cricket match in 1844 between the USA and Canada, predating even the first Test match between England and Australia.Anticipation that Friday's match might be cancelled was high due to a tropical thunderstorm that struck Florida, causing incessant rain and flash flooding.Yet, even if the match had taken place, the USA team, emboldened by their earlier victories and a strong showing against India, would have backed themselves to defeat Ireland and advance to the Super Eights.
Article Summary: First-timers USA advance to next round of 2024 T20 World Cup in the Americas. Their last Group A match against Ireland in Lauderhill, Florida got washed out. The USA vs Ireland washout meant that the 2009 champions Pakistan were eliminated from the tournament.

Article Title: What made Anushka Sharma angry in the stands during India vs Pakistan match?
Article Text:
WATCH:

NEW DELHI: Despite being bowled out for a mere 119 on a challenging track at Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York, Team India triumphed over arch-rivals Pakistan. They restricted Pakistan to 113 for 7 in a thrilling low-scoring encounter, securing victory by a narrow margin of six runs.The standout performer of the match was Jasprit Bumrah , whose fiery spell of 3 for 14 in four overs turned the game in India's favour and left Pakistan disappointed.Amidst the intense India-Pakistan clash, the spotlight also fell on Bollywood actress Anushka Sharma , wife of Virat Kohli , who was visibly upset in the stands during the match.A video of her expressing displeasure while conversing with a man in the stands went viral on social media.However, it was not clear as to why Anushka looked upset and angry in the stands during the game.Following their opening victory over Ireland by 8 wickets, India's six-run win against Pakistan was followed by a convincing seven-wicket triumph over the USA, securing their place in the Super 8s of the tournament.India will next face Canada in their fourth and final group match at Central Broward Regional Park Stadium Turf Ground in Lauderhill, Florida on Saturday.
Article Summary: Team India beat Pakistan by six runs in New York. Pakistan bowled out for a mere 119 on a challenging track. Jasprit Bumrah took 3 for 14 in four overs. Bollywood actress Anushka Sharma was visibly upset in the stands.

Article Title: Ajay Jadeja refused to take money for serving as Afghanistan's team mentor: ACB CEO Naseeb Khan
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Ajay Jadeja played a significant role as a mentor in Afghanistan's impressive show during the 2023 ODI World Cup and ACB CEO Naseeb Khan on Friday revealed that the former India star chose not to accept any payment for his services.Khan shared that the ACB made several attempts to compensate Jadeja, but he turned down their offers each time."We insisted multiple times but Jadeja refused to take any money from the Afghanistan Cricket Board for his services during the 2023 ODI World Cup. His response was, 'If you play well, that's all the money and reward I need'," Khan was quoted as saying by Ariana News.Jadeja was brought on board as a mentor just before the tournament started in India.Under his guidance, Afghanistan managed to secure remarkable victories against former world champions England and Pakistan as well as a strong Bangladesh team.Their run, however, ended after Glenn Maxwell's extraordinary double century.The 53-year-old Jadeja had an excellent cricketing career, playing 196 ODIs for India. He scored 5,359 runs at an average of 37.47, including six hundreds and 30 fifties.In addition to his ODI career, Jadeja represented India in 15 Test matches between 1992 and 2000, accumulating 576 runs at an average of 26.18, with his highest score being 96.Jonathan Trott, the head coach of Afghanistan during the World Cup, credited Jadeja for the team's outstanding performance, which helped them shed their 'minnows' tag.
Article Summary: Jadeja was brought on board as a mentor just before the tournament started in India. Afghanistan managed to secure remarkable victories against former world champions England and Pakistan as well as a strong Bangladesh team. The 53-year- old Jadeja had an excellent cricketing career, playing 196 ODIs for India.

Article Title: South Africa series will ensure continuity, game-time ahead of T20 World Cup: Women's head coach Amol Muzumdar
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Indian women's cricket team head coach Amol Muzumdar highlighted the significance of their all-format home series against South Africa. The series, which kicks off with the first ODI on Sunday, is seen as crucial for ensuring game-time and continuity ahead of the T20 World Cup in October.The women's T20 World Cup will be held in Bangladesh, and Muzumdar emphasized the need to set the right path leading up to this significant event."Yes. That continuity is very important ahead of the World Cup. In this series, we are playing the ODI first and then the Test and the T20s. We then go into the Asia Cup, which is once again a T20 event," Mazumdar told the media here on Friday."By the Asia Cup (scheduled between July 19-28 in Sri Lanka), we should be ready for the T20 World Cup. And then we have a downtime of around seven weeks before we go to Bangladesh. This is a well thought out series and I'm looking forward to it," he added.Muzumdar noted that the team's journey toward the World Cup began with their five-match T20I series against Bangladesh, which they swept 5-0."We had fantastic preparations in the last eight weeks. We went to Bangladesh and won the series 5-0. We practiced on the same ground where we will be playing the World Cup. So, we had good preparation," he said.Although the World Cup is a top priority, Muzumdar stressed the immediate aim is to win the series against South Africa."South Africa have always been a competitive side, as this will be a good, hard-fought series. We are looking forward to it,” he added.Aside from aiming for a series win, the team also seeks to improve their fielding and overall fitness levels."First, we need to win the series. But we will also look into certain aspects. When I took over last December, fielding and fitness were the cornerstone and we have been driving that message to the group."They have responded nicely to that. The fielding is a work in progress,” he noted.Muzumdar expected the Bengaluru pitch to live up to its reputation as a batting-friendly surface."It looked like a typical Bengaluru pitch. We expect good cricket, and hopefully, a good crowd will turn up. We saw that in the WPL," he said.
Article Summary: Indian women's cricket team head coach Amol Muzumdar highlighted the significance of their all-format home series against South Africa. The series, which kicks off with the first ODI on Sunday, is seen as crucial for ensuring game-time and continuity ahead of the T20 World Cup.

Article Title: USA vs IRE: In already wet Florida stadium, groundstaff washes hands on the field
Article Text: NEW DELHI: In a bizarre turn of events, a groundstaff member was seen washing hands near the pitch and behind umpires while wet outfield delayed the United States vs Ireland T20 World Cup game in Florida on Friday.The crucial Group A match between co-hosts and Ireland was delayed as groundstaff battled to remove standing water in the outfield.The toss of the US vs Ireland game which was supposed to happen at 7:30 pm IST was initially delayed by 30 minutes but after the inspection at 8 pm IST, the unsatisfied umpires and match officials decided to further delay the game by an hour.During the initial inspection, a groundstaff member was spotted washing hands that raised a few eyebrows on social media.If the Group A game is abandoned, the USA will qualify for the Super Eights stage, along with group leader India, and Pakistan and Ireland will be eliminated along with Canada.In their third inspection at 9 pm IST, the umpires decided to wait for another hour as the groundstaff continued to toil hard to get the outfield ready.In another rare instance, a special machine was seen being used by the groundstaff to dry up the ground fast.A washout today will also give USA direct entry to the 2026 T20 World Cup and Pakistan will have to play qualifiers.
Article Summary: A groundstaff member was seen washing hands near the pitch and behind umpires while wet outfield delayed the United States vs Ireland T20 World Cup game in Florida. The crucial Group A match between co-hosts and Ireland was delayed as groundstaff battled to remove standing water in the outfield.

Article Title: T20 World Cup 2024: A big score is just around the corner for Virat Kohli, says Sanjay Bangar
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Former India batting coach Sanjay Bangar believes Virat Kohli 's torrid run in the ongoing T20 World Cup will soon come to an end as the team has now shifted their base to Florida from New York.In the first three group stage matches at Nassau Stadium in New York, opener Kohli managed 1, 4, and 0 runs.Kohli's performance has contrasted sharply with his previous stint at the cricketing extravaganza, where he emerged as the highest run-scorer with 296 runs in 2022.Bangar attributed Kohli's struggles to the challenging pitch conditions in New York.India face Canada in their final group stage match at Lauderhill, Florida, on Saturday."Yeah, I agree that Virat Kohli hasn't scored in the New York leg, but none of the other batsmen have also managed to score a lot of runs on this track. This is a tricky surface and therefore I feel that a big score is just around the corner. He is a player who has excelled at the World Cup events and once the tournament moves to the next phase, those competitive juices will start flowing again and he will start putting up performances for his team," IANS quoted Bangar as saying on Star Sports.In their last match, India secured a seven-wicket victory against co-hosts USA, confirming their place in the Super Eight stage of the tournament.Speaking about Suryakumar Yadav's performance, Bangar highlighted how Yadav adapted to the challenging conditions to hit an unbeaten half-century off 49 balls against the USA."The way Suryakumar Yadav made sure that through his batting composure when setting up that chase was really, really good. He made sure that there was stability in the middle overs wherein after the loss of a couple of wickets in the initial overs, he was the one who anchored the chase to perfection."Bangar also praised India's collective bowling effort, which played a crucial role in their successful chase of a modest total of 119 against arch-rivals Pakistan."Obviously, everybody or all the bowlers want to do their roles and complement each other because if you have a partner at the other end who is bowling or who is putting pressure on the batters, then the team eventually benefits. So I don't really want to get into who is number one, who is number two. It just augurs well for the Indian team that all the bowlers are coming together and performing," Bangar said.
Article Summary: Former India batting coach Sanjay Bangar believes Virat Kohli's torrid run in the ongoing T20 World Cup will soon come to an end. In the first three group stage matches at Nassau Stadium in New York, opener Kohli managed 1, 4, and 0 runs.

Article Title: Chennaiyin FC sign Kiyan Nassiri from Mohun Bagan
Article Text: Kiyan Nassiri , a promising Indian striker, has joined Chennayin FC from Mohun Bagan , the club announced on Friday. The 23-year-old, who is the son of East Bengal legend Jamshid Nassiri, began his senior professional career with the Kolkata giants in 2019.Nassiri has committed his future to the Chennai-based club by signing a three-year deal that will keep him at the club until 2027. The young forward's arrival is expected to bolster Chennayin FC's attacking options as they look to reclaim their former glory in the upcoming seasons.The club, which has previously won the Indian Super League title twice, will be hoping that Nassiri's talent and potential will help them in their pursuit of success. The signing of the young striker is a testament to Chennayin FC's commitment to nurturing and developing young Indian talent."I am extremely excited and grateful to be a part of this amazing sea of blue. Bringing all my humility and respect for the management, coaches and fans. Looking forward to bringing with me, my endless passion for the beautiful game and my spirit to win with and for my team.”CFC head coach Owen Coyle added, “When you score a hat trick on your debut against your biggest rivals, it says everything there is to be said. He's a great boy and we have no doubt he will quickly become a fan favourite.”Kiyan, who started his youth career at Calcutta Cricket and Football Club and Mohammedan Sporting Club, later joined Mohun Bagan.Since making his senior debut, Kiyan has scored nine goals in 69 appearances and had two assists.Throughout his career, Kiyan has secured four titles, which include the ISL Cup (2022-23) and the ISL League Shield (2023-24). He has also emerged victorious in the I-League (2019-20) and the Durand Cup (2023).In recognition of his outstanding performance, Kiyan was honored with the Mohun Bagan Best Forward Award in 2022.Kiyan is the sixth player to be acquired by CFC this season, following the signings of midfielder Jitendra Singh, defenders Elsinho and Laldinpuia, and strikers Daniel Chima Chukwu and Wilmar Jordán.
Article Summary: Kiyan Nassiri has joined Chennayin FC from Mohun Bagan. The 23-year-old is the son of East Bengal legend Jamshid Nassiri. He has signed a three-year deal that will keep him at the club until 2027.

Article Title: Germany can beat pressure and Scotland in Euro 2024 opener says Nagelsmann
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Julian Nagelsmann , the Germany coach, acknowledged Scotland 's potential threat in the upcoming Euro 2024 opener in Munich on Friday.Despite the absence of global superstars, he emphasized their agility, dedication, and quintessential Scottish spirit, which makes them a formidable opponent.According to Reuters, Nagelsmann recognized the pressure and tension surrounding the tournament's opening match but stressed its necessity. He expressed confidence in his players, highlighting their self-belief and eagerness to succeed, especially with the advantage of playing on home turf."When I look in my players' eyes ... I see a lot of belief and a lot of confidence, which is what I want ... we have the home advantage, we want to win."Germany's tournament reputation has been somewhat tarnished by a series of disappointing performances since their 2014 World Cup triumph in Brazil. Theysuffered early exits in the subsequent two World Cups and were eliminated in the round of 16 at the last European Championship.Nagelsmann, who assumed the role of Germany manager in October 2023, acknowledged that Scotland would seek to exploit the pressure on the hosts.He emphasized the need for the German defense to remain focused and prevent crosses, as Scotland possesses the ability to create chances and maintain possession.On a personal note, Nagelsmann expressed his emotions leading up to the match, reflecting on his journey from a small village with more cows than people to now preparing for the opening game of Euro 2024 in Munich.Ilkay Gundogan , the Germany captain, praised Nagelsmann's approach, stating that the coach instills confidence, provides clear direction, and discusses roles with the players. This clarity and sense of calm have helped the team, especially in light of their recent tournament setbacks."No other game is like the first one, because then you can use that momentum and that euphoria for the next few games, and that is why the most important objective tomorrow is to win the game," Gundogan emphasized.
Article Summary: Julian Nagelsmann acknowledged Scotland's potential threat in Euro 2024 opener. He emphasized their agility, dedication, and quintessential Scottish spirit. He expressed confidence in his players, highlighting their self-belief and eagerness to succeed. Germany's tournament reputation has been tarnished by a series of disappointing performances since their 2014 World Cup triumph.

Article Title: 'Hungry' England 'want to make history' in Euro 2024, says captain Harry Kane
Article Text: NEW DELHI: In an interview with German magazine Spiegel, England captain Harry Kane expressed confidence in the team's ability to secure their first major men's trophy since the 1966 World Cup at the upcoming Euro 2024 .The striker, who recently moved to Bayern Munich , believes England has a strong chance of winning the tournament, stating, "I'm not saying we'll definitely win the tournament, but we have a really good chance."Kane acknowledged England's past struggles in major tournaments, particularly the heartbreaking penalty shootout loss to Italy in the Euro 2020 final at Wembley.However, he emphasized the team's hunger and determination to make history by winning the title. "In England's history we've struggled to get across the finish line at major tournaments," AFP quoted Kane as saying in the interview.The England captain also touched on his personal ambitions, noting that winning the Euros would be a significant achievement in his career, especially considering the doubts that have accompanied him.Kane, who is England's all-time top goalscorer, also expressed his desire to make amends for missing a crucial penalty in the 2022 World Cup quarter-final loss to France. "It still hurts and I know that pain will probably never go away," added Kane.During the tournament, England will be based at a resort near the central German village of Blankenhain, which features three golf courses.Kane, an enthusiastic golfer who has played regularly with Germany veteran Thomas Mueller since his move to Munich, expressed his frustration with the limited time he has to perfect his golfing skills."That's what frustrates me about golf. I don't have the time it takes to really perfect it," he said.
Article Summary: England captain Harry Kane believes his team has a good chance of winning Euro 2024. Kane recently moved to Bayern Munich from Tottenham Hotspur. England will be based at a resort near the central German village of Blankenhain. Kane is England's all-time top goalscorer.

Article Title: Chennaiyin FC name Noel Wilson as assistant coach
Article Text:
Former champions Chennaiyin FC on Thursday roped in former India international Noel Wilson as their assistant coach ahead of the 2024-25 Indian Super League season. The 44-year-old from Bengaluru has reunited with head coach Owen Coyle. The dynamic coaching duo had previously worked together at Jamshedpur FC where it guided the team to its first-ever ISL League Winners' Shield in 2022.

Noel Wilson (Photo credit: Chennaiyin FC)

NEW DELHI: Chennaiyin FC has brought in former India international Noel Wilson as their assistant coach for the 2024-25 Indian Super League (ISL) season.

The 44-year-old from Bengaluru reunites with head coach Owen Coyle.

The pair had previously worked together at Jamshedpur FC, where they led the team to its first-ever ISL League Winners' Shield in 2022.

Wilson replaces Raman Vijayan.

"It's always an honour and privilege to be a part of Chennaiyin FC. A club which has won 2 ISL Championship and other achievements. I am looking forward to working with Chennaiyin FC to achieve the goal of the club to win games and trophies," Wilson said in a media release.

As a player, Wilson represented the Blue Tigers on multiple occasions and was part of the Indian team that won a bronze medal at the 1999 South Asian Games.

His club career includes stints with notable teams like Mohun Bagan, Churchill Brothers, and Mohammedan SC.
Article Summary: Chennaiyin FC sign former India international Noel Wilson as their assistant coach. The 44-year-old from Bengaluru reunites with head coach Owen Coyle. The pair had previously worked together at Jamshedpur FC. Wilson replaces Raman Vijayan.

Article Title: Naomi Osaka out of Wimbledon warm-up after losing thriller
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Former world number one Naomi Osaka faced a tough exit from the 's-Hertogenbosch grass-court tournament on Friday, losing in an intense deciding tie-break against Canadian Bianca Andreescu.The loss for Osaka came despite an encouraging run on grass ahead of Wimbledon .Andreescu, who is ranked 228 in the world, showed resilience to secure her spot in the semi-finals with a score of 6-4, 3-6, 7-6 (7-3) against the four-time Grand Slam champion.Next, Andreescu will compete against Hungary's Dalma Galfi for a place in Sunday's final. The tournament has seen some surprises, including the defeat of top seed Jessica Pegula, which has opened up the draw significantly."For me today it was just about trying my best to stay in the present moment. She has a great serve, my focus was just to get the ball back into the court on return," Andreescu said after the match."Staying mentally tough was key today."The match was punctuated by two lengthy rain breaks, causing both players to struggle with consistency in the early stages. The games went on serve until the seventh game, when Andreescu took the lead.A powerful return down the line and an error from Osaka gave Andreescu a crucial break. She solidified her lead with a love service game, taking advantage of multiple mistakes from Osaka.Andreescu then clinched the first set 6-4 in 40 minutes, using heavily sliced drop shots to disrupt Osaka's rhythm.However, Osaka made a strong comeback in the second set. She broke Andreescu's first service game with a crosscourt forehand drive on break point and quickly moved to a 3-0 lead.A double fault from Andreescu handed Osaka a double break, allowing her to complete the second set 6-3 with a service winner.Their only previous encounter was also a three-set thriller in Beijing in 2019. The third set here at 's-Hertogenbosch was equally tense.Andreescu, energized and determined, broke Osaka's serve in the sixth game, impressing the crowd with her retrieval skills and inventive spins.As Andreescu served for the match, Osaka fought back with a break of her own, leading to a final set tie-break.In the tie-break, both players had opportunities, but Andreescu kept her composure. Osaka made several unforced errors, including a backhand into the net on match point.Osaka has historically not performed her best on grass, with her Grand Slam victories coming on hard courts at the US Open and Australian Open.However, she has shown potential to be a contender at Wimbledon this year as she makes her return after giving birth to her daughter.Osaka recently had a match point against eventual French Open winner Iga Swiatek in the second round, posing one of the toughest challenges for the world number one on the Paris clay.
Article Summary: Former world number one Naomi Osaka loses in three-set thriller to Canadian Bianca Andreescu. Osaka loses 6-4, 3-6, 7-6 (7-3) in's-Hertogenbosch grass-court tournament. The loss comes despite an encouraging run on grass ahead of Wimbledon.

Article Title: Paris is going to be very, very special: Rohan Bopanna
Article Text: PUNE: It has been a hugely successful year for Rohan Bopanna , winning his maiden doubles Grand Slam at the Australian Open and becoming the World No. 1. And the India star says he is elated to be nominated to represent India at the Olympics for a third time in his career in Paris later this year."This one feels really very, very special. Eight years ago I didn't even think I would play for India (at the Olympics) again. I missed Tokyo and I wasn't anywhere close to representing the country," Bopanna said on Thursday.The 44-year-old Karnataka lad will be pairing with Tamil Nadu's Sriram Balaji in Paris after the All India Tennis Association went along with Bopanna's choice of partner.Bopanna earned automatic qualification by virtue of his world No. 4 ranking -- the top 10 ranked players in men's and women's doubles are given direct acceptance and can choose a player ranked in the top-300 as their partner.Sumit Nagal, ranked 77 in singles as on Monday -- the ranking cut-off date for Olympics entries, is on the list of alternates.June 14 is the deadline for national federations to submit their nominations to the ITF, which will announce the final list on July 4.The tennis competition will be played at Roland Garros, where Bopanna had won the mixed doubles crown with Canada's Gabriela Dabrowski in 2017.He will be at his best in terms of form and mental space too, despite being the oldest player on the ATP Tour."I have been playing very good tennis. Got into the top-10 in rankings and qualified for the Games, the only way I could do it. I have been able to do it twice (having done it in 2016 as well), really happy about it," he said.The past two editions when he competed in the quadrennial showpiece had been marred by controversies with AITA initially refusing to pair him with the partner of his choice before climbding down due to public backlash.This time, however, the selection committee headed by former Davis Cupper Nandan Bal, who had also nurtured Bopanna in his formative years, had respected his decision to pair with Balaji."It is really great that AITA has supported me, and it is a very progressive way moving forward," the Bengaluru lad said.Looking ahead at the Paris Games, Bopanna said: "I am feeling extremely positive, I have been playing some great tennis over the last 18 months and enjoying my time on court. And I want to be able to translate that positivity to my partner."It is going to be a new experience, playing with someone who will be making his debut at the Olympics."I played Balaji in his last match as well (in the third round of the French Open). He had a good match in Paris. The last time I played with him was in the Davis Cup in Bengaluru (against Uzbekistan in 2017)."Bopanna said that the good thing for Balaji would be that he would be playing the Olympics at a "familiar" venue but sought to play down expectations."Balaji has an explosive game and has all the shots," he said before adding, "Olympics will be a very different scenario. He had nothing to lose and played freely (during the French Open)."It is a great opportunity for him. Thankfully it is going to be at Roland Garros, a place he will be familiar with."No matter what, they (rival teams) will be coming for him. It is going to be tough."Bopanna will have his coach Balachandran Manikkath and physiotherapist Rebecca van Orshaegen in his corner at the Games.Balachandran has been a reputed coach in the Indian circuit for many years now. Besides working with Bopanna, he also heads the Bengaluru stalwart's academy located at 'Sport School'.He has also been a part of the Indian Davis Cup team's support staff on a couple of occasions.Currently, Balachandran is also assisting other Indian players who are part of the "Doubles Dream of India" programme -- an initiative by Pune-based tech firm KPIT to support top-200 ranked men's doubles players.Van Orshaegen is a 25-year-old Belgian who played tennis largely at the national level before moving onto sports physiotherapy. She started working with Bopanna a little more than a year ago and has played a key role in prolonging his career."Balu has been working with Balaji too (as part of the 'Doubles Dream of India' project), and knows his game really well. I have seen him (Balachandran) for 25 years, having someone familiar on your side is always a good thing. Rebecca is the most important member of my team. I am 44 now, recovery is a key aspect of my game at this stage."Bopanna and Balaji will look to play together in a couple of tournaments in the lead up to the Olympics."We plan to play a couple of tournaments after Wimbledon, maybe Hamburg and Umag. There is really no time (to prepare) before that. Practising on grass for a tournament on clay doesn't make sense. After Wimbledon is the ideal time."
Article Summary: Rohan Bopanna says he is elated to be nominated to represent India at the Olympics for a third time in his career in Paris later this year. The 44-year- old Karnataka lad will be pairing with Tamil Nadu's Sriram Balaji in Paris after the All India Tennis Association went along with his choice. The tennis competition will be played at Roland Garros.

Article Title: AITA confirms Rohan Bopanna will pair with N Sriram Balaji at Paris Games
Article Text:
Rohan Bopanna (Photo by Mike Hewitt/Getty Images)

NEW DELHI: The All India Tennis Association ( AITA ) has officially announced that Rohan Bopanna will team up with N Sriram Balaji to represent India in the men's doubles competition at the upcoming Paris Olympics . This confirmation comes after reports from PTI suggesting that the 44-year-old Bopanna had chosen Balaji as his partner for his final attempt at securing an Olympic medal.

In a press release, AITA expressed their excitement, stating, "The All India Tennis Association (AITA) is thrilled to announce that Rohan Bopanna and N. Sriram Balaji have qualified for the Paris Olympics 2024 in the tennis doubles event. Their journey to the Olympics marks a significant milestone for Indian tennis."

The decision was reached during a selection committee meeting, presided over by Nandan Bal, a former Davis Cup Captain. Although Yuki Bhambri, India's second-ranked doubles player, was also considered, AITA sources revealed that Balaji's agility on the court ultimately tipped the scales in his favor.

Balachandran Manikkath, who is affiliated with Bopanna's Sports School in Bengaluru, will accompany the team as their coach, while Rebecca Van Orshaegen will serve as the physiotherapist.
Article Summary: Rohan Bopanna and N. Sriram Balaji will represent India in the men's doubles at the Paris Olympics. The decision was reached during a meeting of the All India Tennis Association (AITA) and the Indian Tennis Federation (ITF)

Article Title: Spain's Rafael Nadal to skip Wimbledon to prepare for Olympics
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Rafael Nadal on Thursday confirmed that he will skip Wimbledon this July to focus on preparations for the Olympic Games in Paris.The Olympics will take place on the clay courts at Roland Garros.Nadal, holder of a record 14 French Open titles, has struggled with form after his return from multiple injuries.The Spainard was defeated in the first round of this year's French Open in straight sets by Alexander Zverev, who went on to be the runner-up.The 38-year-old was sidelined for most of 2023 due to a hip injury. His comeback efforts were hampered by a muscle tear, followed by smaller injuries that affected his readiness for the major claycourt tournament."During my post match press conference at Roland Garros I was asked about my summer calendar and since then I have been practising on clay. It was announced yesterday that I will play at the summer Olympics in Paris, my last Olympics," Reuters quoted Nadal as saying."With this goal, we believe that the best for my body is not to change surface and keep playing on clay until then. It's for this reason that I will miss playing at the championships this year at Wimbledon."I am saddened not to be able to live this year the great atmosphere of that amazing event that will always be in my heart, and be with all the British fans that always gave me great support. I will miss you all."Nadal, who won Olympic singles gold in 2008 and doubles gold in 2016, will partner with the newly-crowned French Open champion Carlos Alcaraz to compete in the doubles event at the Olympics.Nadal has previously won Wimbledon twice. He plans to continue his Olympic preparations by participating in the ATP 250 claycourt event in Bastad, Sweden, starting on July 15.The Paris Olympics will take place from July 26 to August 11.
Article Summary: Rafael Nadal will skip Wimbledon this July to focus on preparations for the Olympic Games in Paris. The Olympics will take place on the clay courts at Roland Garros. Nadal won Olympic singles gold in 2008 and doubles gold in 2016.

Article Title: Naomi Osaka powers into last-eight of Wimbledon warm-up
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)

NEW DELHI: Naomi Osaka , the former world number one, showcased her prowess on the grass courts of ' s-Hertogenbosch in The Hague, advancing to the quarter-finals with a commanding straight-set victory over Dutch player Suzan Lamens .The Japanese star, currently ranked 125th, needed less than an hour to secure a 6-2, 6-2 win, her powerful serves and groundstrokes proving too much for her opponent.In the next round, Osaka will face Canada's Bianca Andreescu , who also progressed in straight sets against China's sixth-seeded Yuan Yue."I definitely do feel more relaxed. I feel more calm with the plan I have and just really grateful to be back," said Osaka, attributing her good form to being "more comfortable returning and accepting mistakes as they come."The first set remained on serve until the sixth game, with both players struggling to adapt to the windy conditions.Osaka then seized control, breaking Lamens' serve with a series of powerful shots from both wings, aided by unforced errors from the Dutchwoman. More mistakes from Lamens in her next service game handed Osaka the first set 6-2 in just 26 minutes.Osaka continued her dominance at the start of the second set, breaking Lamens' first service game with a string of winners to take a 3-0 lead. The match concluded as Lamens hit another groundstroke into the net.Despite admitting that grass is not her preferred surface, with her four Grand Slam titles coming on the hard courts of the US and Australian Opens, Osaka appears to be gradually regaining the form that once took her to the top of the world rankings.She has never advanced beyond the third round at Wimbledon but recently pushed eventual French Open champion Iga Swiatek to match point in the second round, the toughest challenge the world number one faced on the Parisian clay.
Article Summary: Former world number one Naomi Osaka beats Suzan Lamens in straight sets. Osaka will face Canada's Bianca Andreescu in the quarter-finals. The Japanese star, currently ranked 125th, needed less than an hour to secure a 6-2,6-2 win.

Article Title: Sumit Nagal wins thriller against Alessandro Giannessi to enter Perugia Challenger quarter-final
Article Text:
Sumit Nagal, the Indian tennis sensation, advanced to the quarterfinal of the Perugia Challenger in Italy on Wednesday. The sixth-seeded player showcased his resilience by overcoming unseeded local Alessandro Giannessi in a thrilling three-set encounter, with scores of 0-6, 7-5, 7-6 (7-5). This victory comes on the heels of Nagal's triumph at the Heilbronn Challenger in Germany last week.

Sumit Nagal. (File Pic - TOI Photo)
Article Summary: Sumit Nagal beat Alessandro Giannessi in three sets in Perugia, Italy. Nagal won the Heilbronn Challenger in Germany last week. The sixth-seeded player will now face either Novak Djokovic or Tomas Berdych.
